channel.title: Mad Hat Economics
channel.description: Mad Hat Economics is a podcast started by Cornell grad students where experts discuss different behavioral anomalies related to economics, marketing, psychology, public policy, consumer preference and food science.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Mad Hat Economics is a podcast started by Cornell…
channel.itunes:author: Mad Hat Economics

item.title: Marijuana And Obesity
item.itunes:author: Mad Hat Economics
item.itunes:summary: In this episode we discuss the health implications of legalized marijuana for recreational use. We found that, in the case of Colorado, BMI actually decreased despite the alleged 'munchies effect'.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode we discuss the health implication…
item.description: In this episode we discuss the health implications of legalized marijuana for recreational use. We found that, in the case of Colorado, BMI actually decreased despite the alleged 'munchies effect'.

item.title: Valentines Day
item.itunes:author: Mad Hat Economics
item.itunes:summary: In this episode we discuss what factors determine gift purchasing for your significant other. The results may shock you.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode we discuss what factors determine…
item.description: In this episode we discuss what factors determine gift purchasing for your significant other. The results may shock you.

item.title: Lotteries
item.itunes:author: Mad Hat Economics
item.itunes:summary: In this episode we discuss the lottery, is it wise to play the lottery and the effects of "winning" on the winners.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode we discuss the lottery, is it wis…
item.description: In this episode we discuss the lottery, is it wise to play the lottery and the effects of "winning" on the winners.

item.itunes:author: Mad Hat Economics
item.itunes:summary: Grad students discuss recent behavioral trends.
